events.description: The National Bank of Moldova maintained its benchmark interest rate at 5%.
A 100 bps reduction in the benchmark interest rate occurred in December.

facts.fact_text: The National Bank of Moldova left its benchmark interest rate unchanged at 5% on February 5, 2026.

evidences.evidence_text: The National Bank of Moldova left its benchmark interest rate unchanged at 5% on February 5, 2026

facts.fact_text: Inflation in Moldova reached a one-year low of 6.8% in December 2025.

evidences.evidence_text: Inflation eased to a one-year low of 6.8% in December 2025, down from 7% in November

facts.fact_text: The central bank reduced reserve requirements in Moldovan lei and freely convertible currency.

evidences.evidence_text: the central bank reduced reserve requirements in both Moldovan lei and freely convertible currency to meet the banking system’s liquidity needs

claims.claim_text: Inflation is expected to return to the target range in the first quarter of 2026.
claims.author: National Bank of Moldova

evidences.evidence_text: is expected to return to the target range in the first quarter, remaining close to target thereafter

claims.claim_text: Reducing reserve requirements will increase lending capacity and support aggregate demand.
claims.author: National Bank of Moldova

evidences.evidence_text: This measure is expected to increase lending capacity to the real and public sectors, supporting aggregate demand by encouraging consumption and investment

evidence.evidence_text: aims to maintain medium-term inflation within ±1.5 percentage points of the 5% target
reduced reserve requirements in both Moldovan lei and freely convertible currency to meet the banking system’s liquidity needs
supporting aggregate demand by encouraging consumption and investment, and helping balance the national economy
